bibl.title: M. L. Coovert for a Writ of Habeas Corpus. Order Attorney Appeal
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US Circuit Courts, Western District of Washington, Seattle; Law Register Northern Division, 1890-1901, vol 1

div1.p: In the United States Circuit Court For the District of Washington
Ex Parte M L Coovert vs.
Filed June 23 1893 A Reeves Ayres Clerk. By R. M. Hopkins Deputy. WC Jones Attorney for Dist Wash
In the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington Ninth Circuit, Northern Division.
In the Matter of the Application of M. L. Coovert for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.

Now on this 23rd day of June, A. D. 1893, comes the State of Washington, by W. C. Jones, Esquire, Attorney General for said State, and prays that an appeal may be allowed to the Supreme Court of the United States from the order heretofore made in this Court in the above entitled cause on the 22nd day of June, A. D. 1893, discharging one M. L. Coovert from the custody of the Sheriff of the County of Clarke, State of Washington, and that all the papers, proceedings and documents relating to said cause may be transmitted by copy thereof, duly authenticated, to the Supreme Court of the United States, next to be holden.

And the Court being fully advised in the premises, and the said M. L. Coovert appearing in open Court by JC Flanders Esquire, his attorney, - It is ordered that said appeal be, and the same is hereby allowed; Further Ordered that certified copies, duly authenticated, of all papers, documents and poceedings in said cause be transmitted to the said Supreme Court of the United States. It is further ordered that the bond on said appeal be fixed at the sum of Dollars Done in open court this 23rd day of June, A. D. 1893.
CH Hanford District Judge presiding in the Circuit Court
In the circuit court of the United States for the District of Washington Ninth Circuit Northern Divison.
In the Matter of the Application of M. L. Coovert for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.

Comes now the State of Washington by the Attorney General, and considering itself aggrieved by the order of the above entitled Court in the above entitled proceeding, of date June 22nd, 1893, discharging the said M. L. Coovert from the custody of the Sheriff of Clarke County upon the Writ of Habeas Corpus heretofore sued out by him, doth hereby appeal from the said order of said Court, heretofore made as aforesaid, to the Supreme Court of the United States, and prays that this appeal be allowed, and that a transcript of all the proceedings and papers upon which said order was made, duly authenticated, may be transmitted to the said Supreme Court of the United States.
W C Jones Attorney General for the State of Washington.
